page.title: 02BIRDS AT KNOTTINGLEY VALE
page.content: On the field of Knottingley Vale school there is a large variety of birds.The Magpie is often seen on our school field,it comes to collect shiny objects.The Crows and Pigeons are very common but the Seagulls are seen more often.We see Blue_Tits and Great-Tits hopping along our field collecting little scraps of food,we also see House_Martins who build their nests in the houses around our school.There are lots of Swifts and Swallows and Chaffinches.The Robin is a shy bird because you only see it occasionally. The Starling and Thrush are common too along with the Blackbird.The Collared Doves, Sparrows and Pied Wagtails also frequent the premises.
